data.headline: S&P 500, Nasdaq, and Russell 2000 slip slightly while the Dow edges higher amid subdued trading volumes
bullets: Tech and chip stocks remain under pressure due to AI disruption fears and fresh competition from Alibaba’s Qwen 3.5
Magnificent Seven names including Nvidia, Apple, Microsoft, and Meta extend declines, contributing to back-to-back S&P 500 weekly losses and a five-week Nasdaq slide
Danaher drops around 5% after a mixed post-earnings report and a miss on expectations
General Mills falls roughly 3–4% after trimming its 2026 forecast
ZIM surges on buyout speculation, while Norwegian Cruise Line jumps about 9% on activist interest
Media and private-equity M&A hopes rise on renewed Warner Bros. Discovery–Paramount tie-up chatter and Blackstone’s pursuit of Champions Group

Traders face thin tech flows and limited fresh data, with focus shifting to upcoming earnings from Walmart, DoorDash, Palo Alto Networks, and others, as well as Fed minutes, jobs data, Q4 GDP, and Friday’s PCE inflation report
